task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 229°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the main building, so I'll tilt up while keeping the same heading to capture roofline for estimation.
The view is now facing north and up, so I must rotate back toward the target building at ~229° to assess its full height.
To estimate height I need the roofline and base in view at once, so I'll look slightly up while keeping the building centered.
The heading unexpectedly reset to north again, so I need to rotate to 229° to face the target building for measurement.
I should now answer with an estimated building height based on typical 2–3 story facade proportions visible from ground to roofline.
